Posts.Content: Thanks for info really helpful. Xxx
Posts.Title: numbness in fingers and toes

Posts.Content: Hi I have been getting numbness in fingers and toes. On paxital and avistan. Also constantly running nose with blood. Going to see onc tomorrow and will ask but in meantime has anyone else experienced these side effects and any suggestions to alleviate. Thanks xxx
Posts.Title: numbness in fingers and toes

Posts.Content: Kate soz forgot to post full name for eyeladh stuff its arbonne lash enhancer. And for scae its arbonne skin conditioning oil xxx
Posts.Title: Cream for scar

Posts.Content: Hi kate Yes was me. Its Arbonne. Us product is a website or may be a person who does a catalgue neae you. I get mine from my lymph specialist. If you are in guildford area I can give u her name. Stuff works really well and no bad stuff in it. If u cant get or not worried re parabans boots no 7 do eyelash and eyebrow growth stick. No idea if any good tho. Xxx
Posts.Title: Cream for scar

Posts.Content: Hi. As others have said everyone can have different side effects but if helpful I have been on weekly tx for three cycles got one more today. Main things for me have been continued hair loss after ec very tired two days after treat so rest and drink water all day. Then gets a bit better can exercise a bit but not too much before back in clinic. Going every week bit time consuming but if less side effects then worth it. Only major prob I have had is anaemia but had that on ec as well so ob a bit suscepible. Good luck its really doable and better than ec. Tej
Posts.Title: Weekly taxol side effects

Posts.Content: Hi. I agree bio oil is great and used before but it is full of parabens. Ive been using arbonne skin gel. You only need to rub a little in and results are better xx
Posts.Title: Cream for scar

Posts.Content: Hi Helen I agree with all amanda has said. Take the meds drink loats of water during and after chemo. Keep a diary how ypu feel as will be reassuring during each cycle how you felt. Whilst we all react differently to chemo you shd not get all the side effects that get listed. Getting a baby toothbrush and non alcholic mouthwashalso good Iidea to keep mouth infection free. I had seven mths of chemo. Gen felt great day after (mainly due to the steroids) crshed and tired day three and four then able to get out and about rest of time tol next session albeit at a much slower pace that wld have before. So not all bad news gave time to catch up with loads of peeps. I did cold cap for four sessions of EC. Hair still fell out. Did not find cap uncomfortable just cold at first then you go numb. Import to get very close fit if u do use. Hardest thing is time it ectends treatment by. Adds hour at beg and two hrs at end. Does not work for everyone but you lose nothing by giving it a try. What I would say if you do lose your hair is it starts to come bacj quickly. Mine started to grow bacj while still on chemo. Enough after two mths to go without wig or scarf as is a short crop. Good luck with your chemo you will be able to do this xxx
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy after double mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Leen I am also at Guildford hospital. Do feel free to send friend request if helps to chat in private. Tej xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed invasive ductal carcinoma.

Posts.Content: Hi I am stage 3 and tnbc. I had just EC. Sure someone more knowledgeable can let you know difference. Just wanted to reassure are those who have just had E C. Theres a realyy helpful thread on things to help during chemo. On EC it is a thick pink liquid which nurses will sit with you and infuse slowly. Tell them how you feel and they can adjust speed as nec. Also goodopp as they will be sittong with you to ask any questions or discuss any concerns you have. Im sure theyve told you your pee will be pink for a few days after. Bit of a shock to start with but soon goes. Drink loads og water to help flush through. Its natural to be worried as its another thing your body has to cope with but it is doable and you have to remember it is doing a job. If it helps I had chemo before op but by completion of chemo I had a complete response so chemo got all the nasties. All studies show tnbc reacts well to chemo. Good luck for Friday. It will not be as bad as you imagine tejxx
Posts.Title: EC vs FEC

Posts.Content: Hi i have to have taxol in second round of chemo. Thought initially be every three weeks but onc says every week for three weeks then week off will be the cycle. Read what it does and side effects. Slightly concerned Re infection and ability to do stuff in weeks having chemo. Anyone else on same regime who can let me know any qs should be asking onc when see next week or any other tips thanx
Posts.Title: taxol

Posts.Content: Thanx. Did you get any advice on when more vulnerable to infection as body wont seem to have much time to recover? In response to earlier thread i am lucky to have private health care thru work. Xx
Posts.Title: taxol

Posts.Content: thanx
Posts.Title: taxol

Posts.Content: Hi. Understand worry before starting as fear of unknown and how you will feel. As Jacqueline has said nurses great and you can ask them any questions during chemo. You shd alsi talk to them re any side effects as there are drugs that can help. If you get an opportunity also talk to others having chemo at same time. Most people happy to share experiences. You will get contact details so if you are concerned at any time you can call your team if you are happy to share drugs you are getting there will also be lovely peeps on here who can share experiences and stuff that worked for them. Whilst nit everyone gets same side effects and what works to alleviate on some does not work for others everything is worth a try. A few practical points drink loads of water during and after chemo. Helos flush toxins through and keeps you hydrated if you get hot flushes. Go with wot your body tells you. If you feel tired rest but try and get a lityle daily walk in to get fresh air. If you do get sick there are good drugs to help. Keeping a note of how you feel is excellent idea as you wont remember everything and when it occurs. Good for you so you know how you will roughly feel in each cycle and to update drs. Mosr of all take adv on days you feel good and do stuff you enjoy. Not sure how long you are having chemo for. I had for seven months and still managed to see friends and have a mini break but best of all is the chemo seems ti have doned its job. I finished two months ago and already effects fading. Ob hair takes the longest to come back but it will get there. Good luck it will be worth it. Xxx
Posts.Title: going for my chemo chat today

Posts.Content: i am currently on EC every two weeks.  dont have an appetite but am making sure i eat at least 3 balanced meals a day and have upped fruit and veg intake.  Thing is I am still losing weight steadily and whilst I could lose some :-) i dont want to get underweight as need to keep in best pysical shape can for the treatments. has anyone else experienced this and any advice. thanx
Posts.Title: weight lose - chemo

Posts.Content: Hi My hair has strated to grow back and currently about an inch long and very fine.  When it first sprouted it was white - lovely peach type effect - so at the moment i have white ends and rest is brownish. difficult to see if grey as well but any hair is good by me. So my question is should it be cut to help it grow faster or leave til longer.  I no longer wear scarves or wig as sort of looks ok?  Thanx In addition when hair started returning my facial hair seems to have grown longer.  Its still fine and white so not growing whiskers or anything but wondered if the longer fuzz will stay or drop out or go back to normal length. is it related to the steroids and is there anything i can do?  so many questions thanks for listeneing. Also for those lovely ladies losing their hair know it willl start to grow back. mine did whilst still having chemp with pacitaxol. xxx
Posts.Title: Hair - again

Posts.Content: Thanx for replies. Be making appoint with my Macmillan hairdresser for a trim:-) xxx
Posts.Title: Hair - again

Posts.Content: Hi Ive been usimg organic almond oil. hair now growing back since end dec and still using it. very mositurising, bit breasy whilst dries even when massge in but no sscent which is good xx
Posts.Title: scalp

Posts.Content: Hi. I had bad pain after EC. Nurse rec hot watee bottle and gentle massage. Pain lessened after month and gone after two. I do however still have scar from collapsed vein. Hope that helps. Good luck with your ladt tax. Tej
Posts.Title: Sore veins post chemo

Posts.Content: Hi During E C I had an injection to boost white cells. Did not have during weekly pacitaxol so if same you nay not need it. Dr shd decide if need a boost based on blood results at each session. After penultimate taxol I did have a white cell boost Injection cos low white blood count. So not a regular thing. Best to query with your chemo nurses to set your mind fully to rest. Xxx
Posts.Title: Paclitaxel

Posts.Content: Thanks. It is lympodema. Got regerral to specialist to try and reduce xxx
Posts.Title: swollen arm

Posts.Content: Hi I am currently on paxitaxol just had first cycle. have had far more pain in breast from this than EC. also right arm is now swollen to the wrist. anyone else had this and can advise.  I am also going to contact BCN thanks TEJ
Posts.Title: swollen arm

Posts.Content: Hi. I had my port put in after first chemo. Op takes about an hour they keep you there til you have peed (nothing secret any more on this journey lol) then went home. I had local but dont remember anything of op. Had op on monday and chemo on friday. All was fine much better than using arm. Bloods and chemo both thru port ( though only in oncology dept everywhere else dont like taking bloods thru port if have to go elsewhere eg a and e) Only issues I had were could not lie on side of port in bed for few weeks while settled and having had one chemo I had bit of reaction to plaster used (but seem to be v sensitive to that sort thing. Youll prob be ok just something to watch for) V glad did it as having weekly tax at moment. Good luck it will be a minor op and make the chemo giving so much easier. You will soon forget you have it. Xxx
Posts.Title: port

Posts.Content: Hi have you tried contacting bcn to see if can help or macmillan helpline. I have lymphodema in both arms. Rhs because of cancer in auxillary nodes. Not had an op. In fact arm swelling was how cancer was disciveted. I got a referral from onc to local specialist i guildford for her to do manual drainage. I have compression sleeves for both arms. Wear as soon as had shower in am and until i go to bed as that was wot was rec. Then cover arms with moisturer for night. Happy to share whar i have been told and just about to start two week intensive manual drainage session every day. Other thing strongly rec was to get antibiotics from dr and take everywhere in case of infection. Tej
Posts.Title: compression sleeve

Posts.Content: I am currently on chemo - EC regimin.  I have a very dear friend who wants to visit, but she has just become a grandma and spending a lot of time with the new baby (as you would expect!).  Is there any additional risk of infection does anyone know or a time to leave after visits when it would be safer.  Thanks for any advice xxx
Posts.Title: risk of infection- chemo

Posts.Content: Maggie i have compression sleeves for both arms plus a right glove for my lymphodema (which is not pots surgery its a result of the cancer in anxillary nodes). I have found that there is a little swelling by end of the day but nothing like what it would be without the sleeves.  If it is swelling too much you should get checked out. i have been given simple exercises to do with the sleeves on to try and keep the lymph moving. plus some basic massge.  Also attending a consultatnt to do manual lymph drainage to try and reseve the fluid retention before it hardens (after which it is irreversible). If you are being asked to pay for these services and unable to do so suggest you speak to the mcmillan helpline. Plus there is a mcmillan booklet all on lymphodema that contains exercise and simple massage that is very helpful.  This can be downladed or ordered as a booklet. good luck as it is no fun - one of worst things about the cancer again cos its so visible probably. tej
Posts.Title: compression sleeve

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone. Info v useful. Any reason why not bottled water? Drinking water lots water as dry mouth and am using bottled at mo. Thanx
Posts.Title: risk of infection- chemo

Posts.Content: Hi sunshine Sorry you are having a horrible time. Waiting for treatment to start is difficult period. Once starts you go with the flow and it becomes more reassuring and theres comfort in the routine. Its nit unusual to have chemo first. Your team will ecplain why its the best action. Write diwn lists of q for each appoint. You wont remember them otherwise. When you know which chemos you are having post the details as there will be someone here who has had simiar and can offer all sorts of help. I had chemo first. Grade three triple negative in rhs. I had six mths chemi which at the end of was told no sign of cancer on scans. So whilst its a bit scary before u start chemo can do a good job. Ask away with any questions concerns you have. We are all at various stages and here to help and support as we were helped and supported when we started the journey. Chemo is not easy but it is very doable. Xxx
Posts.Title: Which Treatment 1st??

Posts.Content: Hi Chrissie I had my op five weeks ago. was more scared of op than having chemo! Natural to feel scared before such an op. The day of the op i had no time to think about it as everyone in team came into room at some point to put at ease. went down for op about 10.30 and back in recovery around 12 (had mx and aux node clearance). I felt no pain after op (good meds :-)).  You may get a strange feeling like little electric shocks just after op but dont worry that is nerves mending and just a surpirsie rather than a pain.  The drains are awkward til you have out but you get a little bag to carry them around in so you will be mobile after a couple of days (takes about that for anethestic to get out of system). best advice is to do all the exercises set as these will help you get feeling back and movement and prevent any cording.  Fell a bit weird at first but perserve (if you get pain when doing tell BCN).  Drains were taken out days after op for me but will vary. since then be able to do all stuff did before just have to be vareful not to lift anything for a while and prob wont drive for  2 ish weeks. I stayed in one night because requested, so worth asking for this.  Its worth it to get rid of the cancer.  Good luck and let us know how you get on. if you wnted to chat in private Mcmillan do a buddy service where they match you up with someone who has been through similar. I found it really reassuring to be able to email direct as well as using this site so is another invaluable service Mcmillan can provide.xxx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: Hi Dendy Just had my fitting tuesday. I wore my softie in a max bra I had bought. I had pulled loafs stuffing out softie til it looked right size then nurse had good idea sort of thing I was looking fir. She bought in a number if diff types falsies and tried all on till looked right. I also wore a vest to try on over bra to give idea what look like under clothes. Nurse also said to wear for couple weeks under diff clthes and wld exchange if felt not right after the short road test. Whole thing took about half hour. Can only sat thats wot I did sure others will have other useful tips. Tejx
Posts.Title: prosthetic breast

Posts.Content: Hi Anne The anticipation gen worse than actual chemo. All the nurses are great and there are people to chat to to take your mind off. Take all meds as instructed. Dont hold your breath when chemo starts it will make you sick (found that the hard way!) I found it helpful to drink loads water during session calming and helps chemo flush thru which its supposed to do. Good luck today. Tejxx
Posts.Title: First Chemo Today - Moral Support Request

Posts.Content: Hi Jeanette hope you are recovering well after your op. i used the cold cap but still lost my hair after 3 sessions of EC.  From what i have seen its a bit hit and miss whether it works.  It extends the time for chemo by about 3 hours (half an hour before start and two hours after. plus waiting for nurses to be available). If you do have cold cap wash hair as little as possible to try and help it not fall out (i only found that out after mine had gone) As mentioned good to sort out a wig before you lose your hair. Tony and Guy have a partnership with macmillan where you can get your hair sorted for free whilst on chemo and they will source wigs for you to try on or your nurses will prob have recommendations of local places for you to get them. Just dont be drageed into paying £300 plus for a wig at a wigshop as there are eqyally good versions available for much less!. Have fun choosing wigs scarves hats etc.  all are good at any time of year. Also may be worth visit to Boots who are also in partnership with Macmillan for a makeover as this will help you make up should eyelashes and eyebrows also go.  Then if they dont go you have still had a fun makeover before starting. Not sure how many FECs you are having.  I had pacitaxol after EC and hair started growing about two months after EC finished. Started off as a peach like look and currently quite dark and about 1 inch but baby fine.  I wash once a week with organic shampoo but rub in organic almond oil every day. Not sure when to get it cut as not at that stage just yet. Hope that helps Tejx
Posts.Title: Hair Care before and after Chemo

Posts.Content: Thanx Denise. Really intetesting. Ive started juicing to trt and improve nutrtion. Can you advise where these coutses are run and how can get on one. Many thanks. Xxx
Posts.Title: A few tips from my Cancer Survivorship Course

Posts.Content: Are nose bleeds also a side effect of pacitaxol.     My nose is running constantly just with light bits of blood. In morning cough up old blood where run dowmn my throat. Gums also bleed when clean teeth use baby toothbrush and mouth wash. Concerned because was on avastin which caused major nosebleed. Four days in hospital via a and e and blood transfussion.  Using Vaseline but nose still not stopping Thanks
Posts.Title: Nose

Posts.Content: i had a blister from the insertion of a port.  It was around the area where the plaster was.  It did leak but the chemo nurses kept redressing for me until it was healed suffiently to dry out.  I was advised that chemo weakens skin and that this can happen.  Also had to remove wedding ring as finger swelled in heat and rubbed.  still got a scar where blister was as still healing 4 weeks later. If drs say not infected that is good but I would insist on regular check ups with nurses in GP or at hospital so they can redress for you.  Anything that concerns you is a distraction and you should keep on to get comfort it is being addressed. xxx
Posts.Title: quite worried

Posts.Content: Hi Dendy I have lymphedema. Mine was reason the docs found the breast cancer. Private message me if you would like to chat in more detail mine is under goodcontrol now. Xxx
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Hi Dendy I used phillips ladshave. Its the pink one quite cheap on amazon. Deodoranti am usingboth zeri frim sanex which I got in boots and dr organic which got at holland and barett. Still using normal shower gel as after mx nurse said ok but have got sone organic shiwer gel from holland and barrett for when start radiotherapy. Body cream using arbonne gel. Hope helps others im sure will have produ cts they have used succesfully so shd give u a selection to choose from. Xxx
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Hi Dendy I have put in a friend request to you. If you accept we can then private message if youd prefer.xx
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Hi Sally I have s portacath. Its always been visible under skin but nit normally stinging. Suggest u phone chemo nurse to get checked out. Prob just settling but best to check. Xxx
Posts.Title: Portacath Pain

Posts.Content: Hi. I had just ec in two weekly cycles times four. Lost hair and tired first few days. A few ulcers but took manuka honey and drunk loads water and ok. Take all the drugs when nurses tell you to even if you feel ok.Ec did thin my skin a bit used loads moisturiser. Also try and go for walks or get some eexercise all helps. Currently on pacitaxol weekly with avastion. Again get tired but avastion worse than tax. Do get running nose as no nose hair. Having said all that side effects can differ. For all cycles I have used a childs electronic toothbrush and change head for each chemo. Hope helps. If in any doubt during chemo phone chemo nurses who can chat through. Let us know how you get on and good luck. Xxx
Posts.Title: Anyone had EC chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi interested to see there is a schedule app which would be v useful. Tried to download and says not compatible with my phone. Got an android. Is there a diff version maybe? Thanks tej
Posts.Title: schedule app

Posts.Content: Hi. So sorry that is the news and i am sure you are both still in shock. You dont say what type the cancer is but if it is triple negative then that responds really well to chemo. I was in a similar situation in that cancer spread to lymph nodes under arm and in chest so could not have surgery they said at first. however after chemo there was no eviidence of the cancer as it was completely resolved. I then had surgery (they gave me the choice) and radiotherapy. I had my first scan after treatment finished recently still showing no evidence of disease. So what I am saying is that this can be beaten even if it has spread so of course enjoy every moment but Im sure there are other ladies like me on here that can reassure that its possible to control it. Good luck at the planning meeting next week. You will prob have loads of questions afterwards. The chemo link given will be great as well. xxx
Posts.Title: Partner has just been diagnosed with Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: So sorry to hear your girlfriend diagnosis. The waiting to know the treatment is a difficult time. As initial meeting when you are first told is understandably devastating. I too did regular checks but could feel nothing even when told where it was. After first meeting had mri ct and pet scans and each were explained by oncologist. Mine also had spread to lymph nodes. I onlt mention that to assure that even if spread it is treatable. Had last year off but just about to testart work. Do let us know how it gors and once have more detailed diagnosis there will be peeps on this site in similar sits and able to answer questions. I know when I was diagnosed this site was a brillant support. It will be for you and your girlfriend too. Sending positive thoughts and wishes tejxxx
Posts.Title: Partner has just been diagnosed with Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi i had that on ec. Bcn said was a side effect of steroids. Lasted for the three days i had to take steroids after each chemo. If you are not taking steroids check with your bcn xxx
Posts.Title: Another side effect question

Posts.Content: I got some v nice scarves from dessinaheadware via amazon. All elasticated so dont have to learn to tie and wont fall off. Defn going to try the recommended annabanda as Well xx
Posts.Title: hats and scarves ?
